speaker: CHASE
line: Pick up. Pick up the phone. Look, I don't know what that bitch told you but I'm solid. She's lying to you. Check her right-hand desk drawer. It's all there, the whole story. Pick up, man. Call him off. Hey, let's talk about this, alright. Give me a chance to explain.

speaker: CHASE
line: Help me. Somebody wants to kill me.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Who wants to kill you?

speaker: CHASE
line: Please help me.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Hold on, don't do that, guy. Now, you calm down.

speaker: CHASE
line: Please, you've got to stop him. He's out there. We have to get him before he gets me.

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Hey, get off.

speaker: OFFICER #2
line: Take him down! Take him down!

speaker: CHASE
line: Let me go. He's going to kill me!

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Take it easy. Relax, now. Settle down.

speaker: CHASE
line: No. This isn't enough. I'm not safe in here.

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Hey, buddy, you've never been safer in your life, OK? Just relax.

speaker: CHASE
line: He can get me in here.

speaker: OFFICER #2
line: I'll go call Social Services.

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Right.

speaker: CHASE
line: It's not enough. He can get to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They've identified it as 9mm pistol ammunition, teflon-coated armour-piercing. Single round. He was shot, there's no doubt about that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I assume the million dollar question is how.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Well, what do we know about the victim?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: CARLTON CHASE. Aged 39. Well-to-do realtor. Single. Lived in the area all his life. Nothing but parking tickets on his record. Came tearing in here last night saying someone was going to kill him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was right.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Except I don't see any bullet holes in the walls.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks to have entered through the top of his head.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Agents, thanks for coming down so quick. Al Trugero.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: John Doggett.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Nice to met you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Agent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: OFFICER
line: I'd appreciate any help you can give us. We've got this much figured out so far.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The bullet came through the airvent.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Yeah, that's how it's lookin'. There's a little burr on this louver right here where the bullet passed through. You can barely see it, but it's there. So, I'm thinking this is where the killer hid. He somehow crawled into this ventilation system and from here he had a clear line of sight to shoot Chase below.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Did anyone hear a gun shot? Seems pretty likely you'd hear one even with a silencer - it's going to echo through the duct-work.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's directly above this?

speaker: OFFICER
line: I don't understand. How could someone make that shot from here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He didn't make it from here. Can I use your pencil?

speaker: OFFICER
line: Sure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Captain! We're going to need your crime scene investigators up here.

speaker: OFFICER
line: You got it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, lucky shot?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Very. But this victim here stated that he was going to be killed just moments before he was shot, which doesn't sound lucky at all.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Guess I can't argue with that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What have you got there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: An old Godfather trick. Wrap a towel around a pistol, muffle the sound. The killer was up here all right. So how in hell did he make that shot?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's thermal imaging technology which can pick up body heat through walls. Maybe that's what allowed him to aim.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We field-tested that in the Marines. Weighs close to 90 lbs. Has to be cooled with liquid nitrogen. I can't quite see somebody lugging it up that ladder we just climbed. Either way, the rooftop of a police station? It's a pretty ballsy place for a hit.

speaker: CHASE
line: Pick up. Pick up the phone. Look, I don't know what that bitch told you but I'm solid. She's lying to you. Check her right hand desk drawer, it's all there. The whole story...

speaker: DWIGHT
line: What are you doing.

speaker: TAMMI
line: My, um, printer cable was loose.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: And that's more important than coffee? Any messages?

speaker: TAMMI
line: No.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Well, the light's blinking. Looks like a message to me. You gonna play it or what? Stupid ain't cute damn you, I don't care what your momma says.

speaker: ANSWERPHONE MESSAGE
line: Yeah, I got like rats, again. I need you to get them all this time. 1806 Brook Valley Turnpike. Last name Allesandre. You've been here before.

speaker: TAMMI
line: DWIGHT.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Yeah, I got it.

speaker: TAMMI
line: No. Look. Did you hear the news this morning? About Carlton Chase? I thought it was pretty scary.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Try and get Randall on the phone.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Randall. Your brother wants to see you.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: RANDALL! You avoiding me? Tammi told you I wanted to talk to you, right? You wanna tell me what happened last night?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Look, Randall, I'm not mad at you necessarily. But I need to know exactly what happened. Any time you decide to do something without telling me first, you could get us both into trouble.

speaker: RANDALL
line: I saw him stealing.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Carlton stealing from me?

speaker: RANDALL
line: Yeah.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: He was skimming. So, where's the money that he was skimming?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: You see, the thing of it is, Randall - you get the money, then you do your thing. It's a simple equation. That's what I'm talking about when I say you need to talk to me first. It'll probably be OK but in the future let's keep the communication lines open. One hand talks to the other, right?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: I brought you a sandwich. Meat loaf the way you like it. Go on, take it, it's got ketchup.

speaker: RANDALL
line: Going out tonight?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The police station's less than a mile from here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Chase ran it on foot. He said that somebody was after him. This is probably where it all started.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: CHASE did a lot of business with an exterminating company called Triple-A-1 Surekill. Six jobs in one month.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I didn't know that was a requirement of selling a house.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's a 45. The bullet that killed Chase at the police station was a 9mm.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, Elvis used to do this to his hotel rooms.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think Carlton Chase did this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So who was he shooting at? If it was someone in this room, he damned sure would have hit 'em.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unless it was someone outside.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Evening.

speaker: MAN 1
line: What? You lost?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Nope. I think this must be the place.

speaker: MAN 1
line: You a cop?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Hell, no. No, your secret's safe with me fellas. But I will be taking that money off your hands, and the dope.

speaker: MAN 1
line: Oh, you're funny. Now, you know what? Chris Rock is funny. And you? You're just dead.

speaker: MAN 2
line: Nah, cap his ass.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Bang.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Bang.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Bang.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thanks.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So which kind of shooting was this? Lucky, coincidental, or some third alternative?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's precision marksmanship, that's for sure. These holes line up perfectly with the three victims behind there, which tells me that the shooter was standing right here behind this wall.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Consequently he wouldn't be able to see what the hell he was aiming at.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unless he could see. The light our eyes can register is only one small portion of the electromagnetic spectrum. Other wavelengths from infra-red to gamma have other properties. X-rays, for instance, can pass through solid objects.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Walls, for example. So, you saying this guy used some kind of X-ray machine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Wait, you, you're not saying this guy has X-ray vision?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I am *remarking* that these wavelengths exist and the only thing that is stopping us from seeing them, if you will, is the biochemical structure of our eyes. I am *conjecturing* that if this structure was somehow different we'd have the ability to see things that we don't.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Call in Clark Kent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: OK, so you explain it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well I can't so I'm sticking to what I do know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which is?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This was a drug rip-off. Furthermore, it's the fifth drug rip-off in this area for the past two months. This guy's making a living capping local drug dealers.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And how does a dead real estate agent figure into that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Now, that I don't know - yet, but I did find out one more thing. Sulphuryl fluoride.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Got a moment to see me in my office?

speaker: TAMMI
line: Dwight. I need to get this to the bank.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: That can wait.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Can't you tell your brother to get some lunch or something at least? He's practically right outside the door.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: I'll keep the noise level down if you will.

speaker: TAMMI
line: I always feel like he's watching me.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: How's he watching you now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Anybody here?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agents Doggett and Scully. FBI.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Dwight Cooper. What can I do for you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mr. Cooper, do you recognize these?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Well I don't recognize much anything except shapes. Tammi! Tammi! Come look at these for me.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: I got bad peepers. Legally blind since birth. These look familiar?

speaker: TAMMI
line: These are ours. Last month's billings for Mr. Chase.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Oh. Carlton. He was one of my best clients. I sent him a ham every Christmas till he finally told me he was a Jew. He was a nice guy.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We found some evidence at a crime scene. A piece of fabric on which we found traces of a chemical - sulphuryl fluoride.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's an insecticide used only by licensed exterminators.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Yeah, it's good stuff. We use it. Along with about 200 other outfits in Central Mass.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You've done time, haven't you?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Yeah, a long time ago. Now my brother and I are actually members of the Worcester Chamber of Commerce, if you can believe that one. Anything else?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, why did Carlton Chase call this office 14 minutes before he was murdered?

speaker: SCULLY
line: 8:34p.m. We found a call to your office billed on Mr. Chase's calling card. It was made from a payphone not far from where he was murdered.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Wow. I don't know what to tell you. We are all gone home by that time and there wasn't any message on our machine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All right. We'll be in touch if we have any further questions.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Tammi. What do you know about that? About Carlton calling here.

speaker: TAMMI
line: He, I guess he must have left a message.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Well, what did it say?

speaker: TAMMI
line: I didn't hear it. I was reaching for the play button and I hit the erase button by mistake. I should have told you. I was just afraid that I lost us some business maybe.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Come here, baby.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: You know I can't see worth a damn. That's when I have a look at your eyes. The eyes are the windows of the soul. They tell you everything you need to know about a person. So tell me, are you lying?

speaker: TAMMI
line: I'm not, Dwight.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: That's all I needed to know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dwight Cooper. Arrested in 1986.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For Grand Theft Auto.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Right. How does a legally blind guy steal a car?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I assume he had a partner doing the driving.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The brother he mentioned - Randall Cooper.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They were arrested together. Although Randall apparently didn't serve much time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They share the same birthday. They're twins.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They ain't twins. Twins never rat each other out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe there's someone in that office who will.

speaker: (CUT BACK TO
line: RANDALL's face.)

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Hey, Tammi, you're in early.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Know you accidentally left your car running? You must have been in a real hurry to get in here to make the coffee. What you got there? Can I see?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dwight Cooper. Warrant to search. Have someone read it to you.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: What the hell are you looking for?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Evidence relating to the murder of Carlton Chase, at all. What's in the box?

speaker: DWIGHT
line: You got me.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's the combination?

speaker: TAMMI
line: I don't remember.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So much for the easy way.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: You owe me for that. You know, I run a clean business here. You're not going to find anything that's going to say otherwise.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I wouldn't be so sure. Can you explain these, Mr. Cooper?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You want to tell me about these invoices?

speaker: SCULLY
line: OK Randall? Let's talk about your exterminating company. There's just the three of you, right? You and your brother and Tammi Peyton?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, how is it that your little company billed over $700,000 to Chase Realty last year?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Seven hundred thousand. That's a lot of dead rats. I think that you and your brother and Carlton Chase were in a whole other business together.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, I gotta get into the bug business. I had no idea you could make so much dough killing things that creep around behind walls.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You are quite the entrepreneur.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: I'm just a regular Joe. Providing a public service.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Randall?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what your brother just said to Agent Doggett?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know why I said that, don't you? Because somehow you can see through that wall. You can see your brother behind me and you can read his lips. I don't know what gives you the ability but I know how you use it. You shoot drug dealers from places where they can't see you and then you and Dwight rob them. That's how you make all that money, isn't it?

speaker: RANDALL
line: No. We're exterminators.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. You certainly are. And talking to you now, I think that the whole thing is Dwight's idea. It's time to be your own man, Randall. It's time to think for yourself.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: You tell them anything?

speaker: RANDALL
line: No, I said what you said.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Well, we got a problem. It needs to be taken care of.

speaker: TAMMI
line: I just keep the books.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You keep the books and a whole lot of blood money going through that office. Now, come on - we're supposed to believe you didn't know what was going on - the drug rip-offs, the murders?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look. Here's where I get confused and I am hoping that you can help me out. Carlton Chase.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We think Chase was Dwight's fence. He sold the drugs your boss stole. Together they had a good thing going, so why was CHASE killed? Seems like bad business.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unless the reason wasn't business. Unless it was personal.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Am I under arrest?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Tammi Peyton's phone records. Found something interesting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Calls to Carlton Chase.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All of 'em late night. What you want to bet they weren't discussing escrow accounts.

speaker: (CUT BACK TO
line: Police Station.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: So Dwight Cooper learns that something's going on between his girl friend and Carlton Chase.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And he kills him, or he orders him killed assuming Randall's the trigger man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe not.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe Dwight's not the one who's jealous.

speaker: (CUT BACK TO
line: TAMMI and RANDALL. RANDALL turns to look at TAMMI.)

speaker: TAMMI
line: I know it was you. You still need help Randall.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Well I made a reservation for the three o'clock bus. You gonna wait for me? It's right over there The Big Sky Express. Be back right after I get the money. I know you took that book to protect me from Dwight. I need my book, Randall. I can't get my money without it.

speaker: TAMMI
line: I'll be back in half an hour, OK? I'll meet you by the bus. Randall, you know I'm coming back, you saved me from Carlton. I owe you. Randall? I'll meet you by the bus.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Clothes are gone. Tammi left in a hurry. Maybe she thought someone was after her.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: If someone's after you, you don't pack, you leave with what you're wearing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think she planned to go?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I do. The question is where.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you calling?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Whoever Tammi called last.

speaker: AUTOMATED MESSAGE
line: Welcome to Concordia Bus Lines. Our menu options have changed. For Reservations, Press 1.)

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Tammi.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Dwight!

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Is this what you had in your secret box? A safety deposit key. You certainly got a lot of my money in there.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Dwight.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Shut up and drive! Drive!

speaker: DWIGHT
line: This is how you did it. You kept two sets of books. You've been ripping me off for months. There's $100,000 difference here. Explains why you were in such a hurry the other morning.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Dwight!

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Shut up! Randall should have killed you, not Chase. Or maybe you and Carlton were working together.

speaker: TAMMI
line: It wasn't like that. When Carlton found out about the money he blackmailed me. He made me do things.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Aww. I bet you put up a big fight. Now, wait a minute, if Carlton wasn't stealing from me then why did Randall kill him?

speaker: TAMMI
line: Dwight. You don't understand.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: No, no, no. I do understand. My brother was sweet on you. He killed Carlton because he knew what was going on between the two of you.

speaker: TAMMI
line: No! No!

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Where the hell you been? Mmm? I got something for you to do.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: Randall, get over here.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Dwight, no!

speaker: DWIGHT
line: She ripped us off, Randall, and you knew it.

speaker: TAMMI
line: No, Randall.

speaker: DWIGHT
line: What did you think? That the two of you were going to run off into the sunset together? She used you. Look at me, Randall . I am the one who loves you. Not her. Not anybody else, because we're blood, that's thicker than anything. I'm going to walk away now. I'm going to think hard about how I can forgive you. You know what you gotta do.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Randall. You're not going to do this.

speaker: TAMMI
line: Randall. Please.

speaker: TAMMI
line: I was coming back for you.

speaker: RANDALL
line: No, you weren't.

speaker: TAMMI
line: RANDALL! No!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent, has he said anything?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. A County DA came in and he declined representation. Aside from that, he's been uncommunicative.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The A.P.B. on Tammi Peyton is a wash so far. The Bureau in Montana is on alert.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well if you're suggesting he could see into her heart, Agent you are out of FBI territory on this one. I'll be out front.
